website_summaries.verdict: Some users compare this low recumbent trike to the popular Big Wheel stunt cycle from childhood. We don't recommend performing stunts, but it does work well for smaller adults and children as a neighborhood cruiser.
pros: Cruiser design for easy trips on flat, smooth terrain
Seat has six angle options for maximum back support
Ergonomic design and durable steel frame
cons: Sits very low to the ground

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what all the negative reviews are about. the only problem I had was assembly instructions. They are wannabees with instructions. They tried to emulate Saw Stop but failed. Pictures are to small to see what you are doing. Hope I put it together correctly. This bike will fit anyone. I am, 5' 10" and had to keep making it smaller to traverse a hill to get the center of gravity lower to make inclines. If you don't make it smaller the front wheel will keep spining.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Willing

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases we've made in a while!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this recumbent because, simply put, it's a LOT easier on my hubby's prostate than any other cycle. The man's 74 and still manages to do miles on his recumbent! I prefer to walk, but he loves it, and runs circles around me and our granddaughter!
customer_reviews.author: Nytyngale

customer_reviews.title: Not Adult Sized
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as adult size, so I ordered for my 74 year old mother who prefers the stability of a recumbent. She is average height, maybe 5'7" and can't ride this without hitting her heels on the ground. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Brandewie

customer_reviews.title: Solid, easy to assemble, good product to cruise around the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.text: We purchase one of these for my 11 year old daughter and she loves it. The product was easy to put together only took about 30 minutes with her help. Everything aligned and just purchased a second one so that we can ride together.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: not enough gear power to make it up a small incline
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as three gears so was expecting to be able to ride up the smallest incline of a hill without the tires slipping! Only gear is to reverse 😢. Should have done a lot more research
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love to walk the dog with this bike! Easy to assemble, easy to ride. Our town is mostly flat with gentle inclines and declines and the 1 speed is perfect for that. It doesn't go real fast but it is a comfortable pace especially with a dog. It does go in reverse which comes in handy. The bike isn't real long, I am assuming it will fit in our van if I ever want to take it some place conveniently.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: Great for children and adults with disablities or balance issues
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to assemble, My 11 year old with Mild CP loves it. It has enabled him to participate in biking with other kids and the family, just wish it was a little faster with a few gears. Disc type brakes would be good also. Other kids always want to ride it, has a cool factor!
customer_reviews.author: K&K

customer_reviews.title: No fun
customer_reviews.text: Does not do well on any incline and only on pavement not at all a fun and enjoyable ride
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: misleading picture thought the item was longer in lenght1
customer_reviews.text: i am going to keep this item but i am fairly disappointed in the quality and sturdiness of the unit i weigh 240 lbs and the trike is very wobbly plus it does not have the feel of a comfortable ride i am going to keep the item because i have assembled it and it would be to expensive for me to ship back also the front fender was damaged ans scratched when i opened the carton not real happy with this item
customer_reviews.author: william l rotella

customer_reviews.title: Easy to ride with back injury!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike! I have a bad back and because of the six different positions I can choose from, I know I will always be comfortable riding this bike. I also Am able to give my dog extra exercise by letting her run beside me as you can see in my video I posted here.
customer_reviews.author: P.Walker

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool
customer_reviews.text: Most is assembled when it is delivered, The rest of the assembly is very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Physical fitness Independence
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Mobo shift it's a great trike for people with disabilitys like myself who was born with Spina bifida I like the fact that it keeps me in shape overall a good product there wasn't anything I didn't like about it
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: ... trail and couldn't catch up with a jogger not happy.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on a level trail and couldn't catch up with a jogger not happy.
customer_reviews.author: James Post

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike for those with balance issues!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice recumbent bike and is the only one I found that has a reverse option. The price is amazing when compared to other like cycles. I do wish it had a rear view mirror and had the ability to lock in place for entry and exit. Otherwise, I love it and would recommend for anyone with balance issues!
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Does not function as described, or the "expert installer" was incompetent.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really work as described. Either not put together properly by Amazon's "Expert Assembly" crew or just a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Stanek

customer_reviews.title: Bolts Sheared Off
customer_reviews.text: My Mobi has been rendered useless after back bolts sheared off.. Poor Design should be welded . I am out $500
customer_reviews.author: Trader_Eric

customer_reviews.title: My autistic son will not ride a 2 wheeler but ...
customer_reviews.text: My autistic son will not ride a 2 wheeler but he loves to ride the mobo shift-it has been a real blessing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Birdsriver

customer_reviews.title: It's very comfortable minus the continual pedaling
customer_reviews.text: I want to use this product for exercise, but the bike does not change gears. I have to constantly pedal to keep the bike moving
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Burris

customer_reviews.title: Why is the front popping. I’m afraid to ride it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this bike for exercise. Something pops in the front wheel, you can feel it in the left pedal the sound is loud. The joint doesn’t stay fixed, the joint slides back on its own. After pedaling, to a certain speed it free wheels. Hopefully the manufacturer can help.
customer_reviews.author: Hubert Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: This is my boys second one. He outgrew his first one. They are well built.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible bike, made poorly. Also missing the hardware to assemble and their customer service is the worst!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay M.

customer_reviews.title: We love these bikes
customer_reviews.text: We love these bikes... I ordered three. We pack them up in the truck and take them everywhere. Usually park rides.
customer_reviews.author: jimmie brewster

customer_reviews.title: great bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a great deal for this price range. My wife needed a trike due to no balance and this one is being enjoyed daily. The only downfall I would say is only one forward speed. The reverse is a VERY nice feature for her at times and well worth the extra few $$. Highly recommend for lower level riding. The price jumps a long ways for one from here, but so does the quality. If you want need a super nice one, at least double the money for one. I also recommend this one for the bigger tires and wheels.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Reinventing the bike and it works
customer_reviews.text: This bike is awesome. Very relaxing and peaceful on the bike trails
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Bike Wheel on Steroids...not worth the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is like the ole fashion kids plastic big wheel. Yet not as good. When watching the video for the Mobo Pro it features some off-road activity. Not hardly!!! And, the Mobo Shift only is good if you want to take it on a boardwalk, a sidewalk or to do on a track. Now, with the limit scope of this product, definitely not worth the $500+ price tag. Save you money and get a true recumbent bike if off-road on streets are what you are looking for. Otherwise, this is for Babyboomers who are trying to recapture their youth and should be marketed as such.
customer_reviews.author: ExumaSky

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike. I had to call techs because the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike. I had to call techs because the wrong nuts were sent with bike to attach rear fenders. Tech support sent out correct nuts and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Moore

customer_reviews.title: Just shy of perfect
customer_reviews.text: Needs higher qual. tires, the compound gets worn quickly. If the Drive Hub had multi gearing capability I would give it 10 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M. Zitzewitz

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my son who has ADD since he would have difficulty paying attention and riding at the same time. It is working out very well and I would recommend it. He loves to ride it and now he can go riding with the whole family. Keep in mind that it does not have gears so it will not go as fast as a standard bike which I find to be a plus. Remember to tighten all screws, even on parts that are pre-assembled, after riding as this is not entirely welded but rather bolted together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cruiser to get around in the neighborhood, because I'm no longer able to drive due to health issues. The Mobo Cruiset is a joy to ride. Lots of fun too.
customer_reviews.author: Carlita France

customer_reviews.title: Touchy reverse, good otherwise
customer_reviews.text: We are processing your review. This may take several days, so we appreciate your patience. We will notify you when this is complete. Please note that if the review is about your experience with a third-party seller, we may move it to the seller’s profile page.
customer_reviews.author: Nataliehoke

customer_reviews.title: Really a lot of fun to ride at any age!
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and rides well, does not reverse, but easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: Berta

customer_reviews.title: JUNK DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: hate this bike with passion it has 1 speed- SLOW!! wobbles all over the place unstable with my dog pulling me faster than I can even pedal and the wheels are already out of alignment and barely moves JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie kenyon

customer_reviews.title: mono trike
customer_reviews.text: I like this item and enjoy it, but I'm at the mercy of my husband in order to use it! I live out in the country and want to take it somewhere to ride it, but it doesn't fold up, nor can I live it. It has to be put in the bed of his truck and it takes 2 of us to lift it. I wish they offered a carrier for the back of my small car for it. I would go everyday. now I'm lucky I can go 1 time a month. cause he doesn't want to sit and wait for me. but do enjoy it! so do my grandkids
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: We had this professionally put together and it was awful ...
customer_reviews.text: We had this professionally put together and it was awful from the start. Front wheel went flat within two weeks and had only been ridden a few times. We bought it for an elderly friend to get exercise and he had a lot of trouble getting in and out of it. The front wheel spins because of not enough traction on the road/sidewalk. We consider this questionably safe and money down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Fun on 3 Wheels
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this thing. Smooth ride, easy to steer. Everybody who I've let try it wants one too. About to order another because my son and husband love it just as much. Make sure you shop around. Prices vary between $430-$810 for this model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replace not repair !
customer_reviews.text: Parts cannot be found when needed . Wheel spokes must be custome made . Tires wear out in a few months .
customer_reviews.author: L. Ramirez

product_meta.title: Mobo Shift 3-Wheel Recumbent Bicycle Trike
product_meta.description: Offering a unique twist to the classic cruiser design, the Mobo® Shift is engineered with a "reverse" function for all-around excitement! Additional features include freewheel maneuverability, a dual-joystick steering system and a reclining back seat with 6 angle settings to optimize comfort and support. It's equipped with an adjustable frame that fits most heights, and its larger design promises a relaxing, safe, and fun-filled experience.
feature_bullets: 3-Wheel recumbent bike - enjoy the outdoors with this adult tricycle for men and women. Designed for cruising and exercise on flat paved surfaces and gently sloping terrain
Reverse gear – equipped with reverse gear (in addition to 1 forward gear). back up in a snap!
No balance required - low center of gravity provides maximum stability. Dual-joystick steering offers smooth maneuverability with simple hand movements
Large & small riders - easily adjusts to fit riders from 4’0” to 6’3” and weighing up to 250 lbs. Plus ergonomic reclining-back seat gives you six angle settings

Durable - Hi-Ten steel frame. No-maintenance chainless design. Wheels: 20” front, 16” rear. Free-wheel hub, caliper brakes, safety flag. Dimensions: 28 x 25. 6 x 48 inches (62” extended). weight 44 lbs. Adult three-wheel bike for women, men, and ages 10+
- Mobo Cruiser is a US company with US customer support. We ensure customer satisfaction and stand behind our products 100%
